alert.note: Alert for Ellis; Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 10:36PM CDT until October 05 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Ellis, Johnson, and southern Dallas counties. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Mansfield, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Burleson, Lancaster, Waxahachie, Cleburne, Balch Springs, Ennis, Midlothian, Seagoville, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Keene, Joshua and Hutchins.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
